de.modlab.smilib.fragments
Class ComponentAdministrator

java.lang.Object
  de.modlab.smilib.fragments.ComponentAdministrator

public class ComponentAdministrator
extends java.lang.Object

Stores and distributes SMILES of scaffolds, linkers and building blocks.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

ComponentAdministrator

public ComponentAdministrator(java.lang.String scaffoldsPath,
                              java.lang.String linkersPath,
                              java.lang.String buildingBlocksPath,
                              boolean checkSmiles)
                       throws SmiLibIOException,
                              SmiLibConformityException
Creates a new instance of ComponentAdministrator.

Parameters:
scaffoldsPath - path/name of the file that contains scaffolds as SMILES
linkersPath - path/name of the file that contains linkers as SMILES
buildingBlocksPath - path/name of the file that contains building blocks as SMILES
checkSmiles - check SMILES for conformity with SMiLib rules true/false
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Exception thrown when error persing source SMILES
SmiLibIOException
SmiLibConformityException

ComponentAdministrator

public ComponentAdministrator(java.lang.String[] scaffolds,
                              java.lang.String[] linkers,
                              java.lang.String[] buildingBlocks,
                              boolean checkSmiles)
                       throws SmiLibIOException,
                              SmiLibConformityException
Creates a new instance of ComponentAdministrator, used when SMiLib ist started in GUI mode.

Parameters:
scaffolds - array containing scaffold SMILES
linkers - array containing linker SMILES
buildingBlocks - array containing buildingBlock SMILES
checkSmiles - check SMILES for conformity with SMiLib rules true/false
Throws:
SmiLibIOException - if an IO error occures
SmiLibConformityException - if a SMILES string does not conform to SmiLib restrictions
Method Detail

numberBlacklisted

public boolean numberBlacklisted(int num,
                                 int scaff,
                                 int linker,
                                 int bBlock)
Returns whether a number is blacklisted (already used) in a scaffold/linker/building block combination and because of that can not be used in the concatenation of the specified molecule parts..

Parameters:
num - number that is maybe blacklisted
scaff - index of the current scaffold
linker - index of the current linker
bBlock - index of the current building block
Returns:
true if num is blacklisted, false if not.
